title: Jurgen Klopp reacts after seven Liverpool stars receive Ballon d’Or nominations
text:
Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has reacted to the Ballon d’Or shortlist (Picture: Getty)

Jurgen Klopp says the inclusion of seven Liverpool players on the 2019 Ballon d’Or shortlist is deserved recognition for his team’s performances last season.

The Reds lifted the Champions League and finished just one point behind Premier League champions Manchester City last term.

On the back of that impressive campaign, Trent Alexander-Arnold, Alisson Becker, Roberto Firmino, Sadio Mane, Mohamed Salah, Virgil van Dijk and Georginio Wijnaldum were all named among the 30 contenders for the Ballon d’Or.

Ballon d'Or shortlist Virgil van Dijk (Liverpool) Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) Son Heung-min (Tottenham) Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) Alisson (Liverpool) Matthijs de Ligt (Juventus) Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) Frenkie de Jong (Barcelona) Hugo Lloris (Tottenham) Dusan Tadic (Ajax) Cristiano Ronaldo (Juventus) Kylian Mbappe (Paris St-Germain) Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool)󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿 Donny van de Beek (Ajax) Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal) Marc-Andre ter Stegen (Barcelona) Sadio Mane (Liverpool) Lionel Messi (Barcelona) Riyad Mahrez (Manchester City) Kevin de Bruyne (Manchester City) Kalidou Koulibaly (Napoli) Antoine Griezmann (Barcelona) Mohammed Salah (Liverpool) Eden Hazard (Real Madrid) Marquinhos (Paris St-Germain) Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) Joao Felix (Atletico Madrid)

The winner will be revealed in Paris on December 2.

Klopp, reacting to the shortlist, told Liverpool’s official website: ‘I am not sure who is not on the list from our boys! It is nice.

‘We have had so much attention and reward for the things that happened last year and that’s all good. There is one more big day and then last season is closed.

‘The boys deserved it. It is the big one and I am not sure it happened too often that seven players from one club were on the shortlist and that’s good.

‘In the end, someone will decide it. It’s nice and it’s what the boys deserve for the season they played last year.’

Five Manchester City stars – Raheem Sterling, Riyad Mahrez, Kevin de Bruyne, Bernardo Silva and Sergio Aguero – are on the shortlist.

Tottenham’s Hugo Lloris and Son Heung-min are also included as well as prolific winners Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi.

Premier League leaders Liverpool, who drew 1-1 with Manchester United on Sunday, face Genk in the Champions League tomorrow evening.

Champions League holders Liverpool lost their opening game of this season’s tournament but bounced back against Red Bull Salzburg at the start of the month.
